page.title: 02Community Surveys
page.content: The vast majority of interviewees believed that their area had changed, it had grown attracting more people, houses and shops. They found these changes reasonable but were irritated by the increased volume of traffic and consequent parking restrictions. Most interviewees believed Pocklington people to be friendly, representing a cross section of types and social classes of people found in England today. The majority had not taken part in any special festival or event during the last year, of those who had most were connected with their church or with agricultural shows. Save for supposed ghosts at The Feathers Hotel and 'Penny Arcadia Museum', no unusual beliefs or customs were mentioned or known of by those interviewed. Most peoples favourite place in the area was Burnby Hall Gardens.
